message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a new method for human action recognition using semantic images and deep learning networks. The approach involves using localized sparse segmentation and global clustering prior to approximate rank pooling to summarize motion characteristics in single or multiple images. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes the use of Inception-ResNetv2 and long-short-term memory network (LSTM) to leverage temporal variances for improved recognition performance, which suggests that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also evaluates its proposed method on UCF101 and HMDB51 datasets, which are commonly used in multimedia (cs.MM) research. Finally, the paper uses a four-stream network architecture pre-trained on ImageNet + Kinetics and fine-tuned using the proposed representation to achieve state-of-the-art performance, which suggests that it may also belong to the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
